Effects & Lifecycle

Effects let you perform side effects like data fetching, DOM manipulation, and subscriptions in response to reactive changes.

createEffect

Effects run immediately and automatically re-run when their dependencies change:

1import { createSignal, createEffect } from 'philjs-core';
2 
3const [count, setCount] = createSignal(0);
4 
5createEffect(() => {
6  console.log('Count is:', count());
7});
8 
9// Logs: "Count is: 0"
10 
11setCount(1);
12// Logs: "Count is: 1"
i

Automatic Tracking

Effects automatically track all signals read inside them. No dependency array needed!

Lifecycle Hooks

onMount

Runs once when the component is first created:

1import { onMount } from 'philjs-core';
2 
3function DataComponent() {
4  const [data, setData] = createSignal(null);
5 
6  onMount(async () => {
7    console.log('Component mounted');
8    const result = await fetchData();
9    setData(result);
10  });
11 
12  return <div>{data() || 'Loading...'}</div>;
13}

onCleanup

Register cleanup functions for subscriptions, timers, and event listeners:

1import { onMount, onCleanup } from 'philjs-core';
2 
3function Timer() {
4  const [seconds, setSeconds] = createSignal(0);
5 
6  onMount(() => {
7    const interval = setInterval(() => {
8      setSeconds(s => s + 1);
9    }, 1000);
10 
11    onCleanup(() => {
12      console.log('Cleaning up timer');
13      clearInterval(interval);
14    });
15  });
16 
17  return <div>Elapsed: {seconds()}s</div>;
18}
19 
20// Cleanup also works in effects
21createEffect(() => {
22  const subscription = observable.subscribe(value => {
23    console.log(value);
24  });
25 
26  onCleanup(() => subscription.unsubscribe());
27});

createMemo

Memos are cached computed values that only recalculate when dependencies change:

1import { createSignal, createMemo } from 'philjs-core';
2 
3const [firstName, setFirstName] = createSignal('John');
4const [lastName, setLastName] = createSignal('Doe');
5 
6const fullName = createMemo(() => {
7  console.log('Computing full name');
8  return `${firstName()} ${lastName()}`;
9});
10 
11// First access - computes
12console.log(fullName()); // Logs: "Computing full name", "John Doe"
13 
14// Second access - uses cache
15console.log(fullName()); // Just "John Doe"
16 
17// Update dependency - recomputes
18setFirstName('Jane');
19console.log(fullName()); // Logs: "Computing full name", "Jane Doe"

When to Use Memos

  • Expensive computations that should be cached
  • Derived state from multiple signals
  • Filtering or transforming lists
  • Complex calculations in JSX
1const [todos, setTodos] = createSignal<Todo[]>([]);
2const [filter, setFilter] = createSignal<'all' | 'active' | 'completed'>('all');
3 
4// Good: Expensive filtering is memoized
5const filteredTodos = createMemo(() => {
6  const allTodos = todos();
7  const currentFilter = filter();
8 
9  return currentFilter === 'all'
10    ? allTodos
11    : allTodos.filter(t =>
12        currentFilter === 'active' ? !t.completed : t.completed
13      );
14});
15 
16// Bad: Recomputes on every render
17return (
18  <For each={todos().filter(t => !t.completed)}>
19    {/* ... */}
20  </For>
21);

Effect Patterns

Data Fetching

1function UserProfile(props: { userId: string }) {
2  const [user, setUser] = createSignal<User | null>(null);
3  const [loading, setLoading] = createSignal(true);
4  const [error, setError] = createSignal<Error | null>(null);
5 
6  createEffect(() => {
7    const id = props.userId; // Track userId changes
8 
9    setLoading(true);
10    setError(null);
11 
12    fetch(`/api/users/${id}`)
13      .then(res => res.json())
14      .then(data => {
15        setUser(data);
16        setLoading(false);
17      })
18      .catch(err => {
19        setError(err);
20        setLoading(false);
21      });
22  });
23 
24  return (
25    <Show when={!loading()} fallback={<Spinner />}>
26      <Show when={!error()} fallback={<Error error={error()!} />}>
27        <div>{user()?.name}</div>
28      </Show>
29    </Show>
30  );
31}

Local Storage Sync

1function useLocalStorage<T>(key: string, initial: T) {
2  const [value, setValue] = createSignal<T>(initial);
3 
4  // Load from localStorage on mount
5  onMount(() => {
6    const stored = localStorage.getItem(key);
7    if (stored) {
8      try {
9        setValue(JSON.parse(stored));
10      } catch (e) {
11        console.error('Failed to parse stored value:', e);
12      }
13    }
14  });
15 
16  // Save to localStorage on changes
17  createEffect(() => {
18    localStorage.setItem(key, JSON.stringify(value()));
19  });
20 
21  return [value, setValue] as const;
22}
23 
24// Usage
25const [theme, setTheme] = useLocalStorage('theme', 'light');

Event Listeners

1function useWindowSize() {
2  const [width, setWidth] = createSignal(window.innerWidth);
3  const [height, setHeight] = createSignal(window.innerHeight);
4 
5  onMount(() => {
6    const handleResize = () => {
7      setWidth(window.innerWidth);
8      setHeight(window.innerHeight);
9    };
10 
11    window.addEventListener('resize', handleResize);
12 
13    onCleanup(() => {
14      window.removeEventListener('resize', handleResize);
15    });
16  });
17 
18  return { width, height };
19}
20 
21// Usage
22function ResponsiveComponent() {
23  const { width, height } = useWindowSize();
24 
25  return <div>Window size: {width()} x {height()}</div>;
26}

createResource

Resources simplify async data fetching with built-in loading and error states:

1import { createResource } from 'philjs-core';
2 
3const [userId, setUserId] = createSignal(1);
4 
5const [user] = createResource(
6  userId, // Source signal - refetches when this changes
7  async (id) => {
8    const res = await fetch(`/api/users/${id}`);
9    return res.json();
10  }
11);
12 
13return (
14  <div>
15    <Show when={!user.loading} fallback={<p>Loading...</p>}>
16      <Show when={!user.error} fallback={<p>Error: {user.error.message}</p>}>
17        <h1>{user()?.name}</h1>
18      </Show>
19    </Show>
20  </div>
21);

Resource Methods

1const [data, { refetch, mutate }] = createResource(fetcher);
2 
3// Refetch the data
4refetch();
5 
6// Optimistically update
7mutate(newValue);
8 
9// Check state
10data.loading; // boolean
11data.error; // Error | null
12data.state; // 'pending' | 'ready' | 'refreshing' | 'errored'

Batch Updates

1import { batch } from 'philjs-core';
2 
3const [firstName, setFirstName] = createSignal('John');
4const [lastName, setLastName] = createSignal('Doe');
5 
6createEffect(() => {
7  console.log(`${firstName()} ${lastName()}`);
8});
9 
10// Without batch: effect runs twice
11setFirstName('Jane');
12setLastName('Smith');
13// Logs: "Jane Doe"
14// Logs: "Jane Smith"
15 
16// With batch: effect runs once
17batch(() => {
18  setFirstName('Alice');
19  setLastName('Johnson');
20});
21// Logs: "Alice Johnson"

Untracked Reads

1import { untrack } from 'philjs-core';
2 
3const [count, setCount] = createSignal(0);
4const [multiplier, setMultiplier] = createSignal(2);
5 
6// Effect only tracks count, not multiplier
7createEffect(() => {
8  const currentCount = count();
9  const currentMultiplier = untrack(multiplier);
10  console.log(currentCount * currentMultiplier);
11});
12 
13setCount(5); // Logs: 10
14setMultiplier(3); // Doesn't log (not tracked)

on() - Explicit Dependencies

1import { on } from 'philjs-core';
2 
3const [a, setA] = createSignal(0);
4const [b, setB] = createSignal(0);
5 
6// Only track 'a', even though we read 'b'
7createEffect(
8  on(a, (value) => {
9    console.log('a changed to:', value);
10    console.log('b is:', b()); // Read but don't track
11  })
12);
13 
14setA(1); // Logs
15setB(2); // Doesn't log

createDeferred

Defer updates to reduce unnecessary work during rapid changes:

1import { createDeferred } from 'philjs-core';
2 
3const [input, setInput] = createSignal('');
4const deferredInput = createDeferred(input, { timeoutMs: 500 });
5 
6// deferredInput only updates after 500ms of no changes
7createEffect(() => {
8  // Expensive operation
9  searchAPI(deferredInput());
10});
11 
12// Rapid typing only triggers one search
13setInput('h');
14setInput('he');
15setInput('hel');
16setInput('hello'); // Search runs 500ms after this

Best Practices

  1. Use memos for computations: Don't repeat expensive calculations
  2. Clean up effects: Always use onCleanup for resources
  3. Batch related updates: Prevent unnecessary effect runs
  4. Use resources for async: Simpler than manual effect + state
  5. Avoid conditional reads: Read signals at the top level of effects
  6. Be careful with dependencies: Understand what triggers re-runs

Common Pitfalls

Reading Signals Outside Effects

1// Bad: Read outside effect
2const value = count();
3createEffect(() => {
4  console.log(value); // Won't update!
5});
6 
7// Good: Read inside effect
8createEffect(() => {
9  console.log(count()); // Updates correctly
10});

Infinite Loops

1// Bad: Creates infinite loop
2const [count, setCount] = createSignal(0);
3createEffect(() => {
4  setCount(count() + 1); // Triggers effect again!
5});
6 
7// Good: Guard condition or use different approach
8createEffect(() => {
9  if (count() < 10) {
10    setCount(count() + 1);
11  }
12});
